definition: lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
variant of 紙|纸[zhi3]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Printmaking is the process of making artworks by printing, normally on paper.
sentences.chinese: 版画是制作过程艺术品印刷，通常是纸上谈兵。

sentences.english: The other occasions for you to understand how to control emotion is basically talking about your pipe dreams.
sentences.chinese: 其余任何时刻对于情绪控制的理解，都是纸上谈兵。

sentences.english: I doubt we shall not get much nearer to the nature of love by mere talking.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们只是纸上谈兵，那就不可能了解到爱之真谛。

sentences.english: " Otherwise one part person put forward "light is navel-gazing is equal to talk.
sentences.chinese: 另有一部分人提出“光是纸上谈兵等于空谈。

sentences.english: Don't just discuss your theories, test them, and test them today.
sentences.chinese: 不要再纸上谈兵了，实验它，而且今天就实验。

definition: prattle/idle chit-chat
empty talk/bunk/malicious gossip
to speak in general terms
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
a wooden word-by-word reading
to make empty promises
attractive appearance, but without substance
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
Actual practice is the sole criterion for judging truth (item from Deng Xiaoping theory, from 1978)
pinyin: shi2 jian4 shi4 jian3 yan4 zhen1 li3 de5 wei2 yi1 biao1 zhun3
related.word: 实践是检验真理的唯一标准

definition: all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
superficial show/going through the motions
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
to sit and pontificate; to find answers through theory and not through practice (idiom)
